meanings.definition: Those who cause something to disappear or scatter.
meanings.sent1: The dissipaters of the leaves in the wind were the mischievous children playing outside.
meanings.sent2: The dissipaters of the crowd were the sudden loud noises.
meanings.sent3: The dissipaters of the cookies were the hungry siblings who couldn't resist.
meanings.sent4: The dissipaters of the fog were the rays of the morning sun.
meanings.sent5: The dissipaters of the sand were the strong gusts of wind at the beach.

meanings.sent1: She dissipaters the seeds in the garden to help them grow.
meanings.sent2: The wind dissipaters the smoke from the chimney across the sky.
meanings.sent3: He dissipaters the bubbles in his drink by blowing on them.
meanings.sent4: The magician dissipaters the cards in a mesmerizing trick.
meanings.sent5: The rain dissipaters the clouds, revealing a clear blue sky.

meanings.definition: Causing something to disappear or scatter.
meanings.sent1: The dissipaters wind carried the fallen leaves far away.
meanings.sent2: The dissipaters spell made the treasure vanish into thin air.
meanings.sent3: The dissipaters powder turned invisible once sprinkled on the table.
meanings.sent4: The dissipaters fog obscured the view of the distant mountains.
meanings.sent5: The dissipaters magic trick amazed the audience as the coins disappeared.
